features.name: Testing Infrastructure Setup
features.description: Install and configure Jest with React Testing Library and TypeScript support. Install required dependencies: jest, @testing-library/react, @testing-library/jest-dom, @testing-library/user-event, ts-jest, @types/jest, jest-environment-jsdom. Create jest.config.js with TypeScript preset (ts-jest), jsdom test environment, and proper module resolution. Create setupTests.ts to import '@testing-library/jest-dom'. Update package.json test script to 'jest' with proper flags.

should have jest.config.js with ts-jest preset and jsdom environment
should run 'npm test' without errors (even with no tests)
should recognize .test.tsx files for testing

features.name: Counter Component Core Structure and State
features.description: Create src/Counter.tsx as a functional TypeScript component. Set up component with no props (React.FC or function Counter()). Initialize state using useState<number>(0) for the counter value. Define TypeScript types for the component. Create basic JSX structure with a container div. Export as named export: export const Counter or export function Counter.

testCases.name: should export Counter as a named export from Counter.tsx
should be a functional component with proper TypeScript typing
should not accept any props (props interface is empty or absent)
should initialize count state to 0 using useState

features.name: Counter Event Handlers and Business Logic
features.description: Implement three event handler functions in Counter component: handleIncrement (() => setCount(count + 1)), handleDecrement (() => setCount(count - 1)), and handleReset (() => setCount(0)). Ensure proper TypeScript typing for handlers (void return type). Verify counter supports negative values (no bounds checking). Test that handlers correctly update state.

testCases.name: should have handleIncrement function that adds 1 to count
should have handleDecrement function that subtracts 1 from count
should have handleReset function that sets count to 0
should support negative values when decrementing below 0
should have proper TypeScript types for all handler functions

features.name: Counter UI Rendering and Inline Styles
features.description: Build complete Counter UI with JSX structure and inline styles. Create layout: container div (centered, padding), counter display showing {count} value (large font ~48px, bold, centered), and three buttons in horizontal row below counter. Button labels: '-' (decrement), '+' (increment), 'Reset'. Wire onClick handlers to each button. Apply all styles inline using style prop with proper React style objects (camelCase properties). No external CSS files or styled-components.
